title: Has solar panel paint been invented yet? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes it has been invented. It will be commercially available within few years. Here’s an article which will help you to know more about solar paint. Researchers at RMIT University in Melbourne(Australia) have developed an innovative solar paint that produces endless clean energy from water vapour. This revolutionary paint takes up moisture from the air and splits into oxygen and hydrogen. This hydrogen emitted is captured as energy.  The paint combines the titanium oxide, a white pigment used in many wall paints with a new compound called synthetic molybdenum-sulphide. This molybdenum-sulphide acts like a silica gel, which is used to absorb moisture and keep the things fresh and dry. Synthetic molybdenum-sulphide acts as a semi-conductor and also catalysis the splitting of water molecules into hydrogen and oxygen. As a result, hydrogen is captured as a fuel source. A simple addition of new material to titanium oxide converts a wall into energy harvesting and fuel producing wall. Read more here :This new solar paint creates endless energy from water vapour

Yes, and no. Depends on what you call 'invention'. And, to a large degree, what you mean by 'paint'.   Have they been prototyped in labs, and discussed academically? Yes! Plasmonic-Enhanced Organic Photovoltaics: Breaking the 10% Efficiency Barrier Are they ready for entering the product line through mass production, testing and field studies? Not yet.  I would advise people to exercise some healthy skepticism when reading tech websites that promise new groundbreaking technology. From academic papers to science reporting, it looks like some stories take a life of their own. Here is a humorous illustration of what I am talking about From PhD Comics. : Science News Cycle
